## Plan for Next Three Classes

* Today: Lab Day/Check-ins

* Thurs: Mock Consulting Sessions with DCDS Advisory Board Members

* Next Tuesday: Progress Report #2 Presentations

## Mock Consulting

* Please be here by 9:59am.
* There will be a photographer.  Please let me know if you would like to not be photographed.
    + These photos will be featured in DCDS-related venues, such as the website, LinkedIn, and the newsletter.  
* We will start in 212 but then will use both 212 and 210.  
* Our mock clients will be 5-6 people from the [DCDS Advisory Board Members](https://www.bucknell.edu/academics/beyond-classroom/academic-centers-institutes/dominguez-center-data-science/about-dcds/dcds-advisory-board).


---

## Mock Consulting

* Suggested attire: Business casual
* I will assign each of you to a consulting team and you will participate in two 15 minute mock sessions.
* Be ready to:
    + Run a 15 minute meeting.
    + Learn about their fictitious project.
    + Ask good questions.
    + Provide initial thoughts on how you'd approach the project.
    + Summarize the meeting and outline next steps.

---

## Next Tuesday: Second Round of Progress Report Presentations


* Progress report 1 feedback has been shared in Gradescope and Google Drive.

* Five minute presentation
    + Will be held to the time limit.
    + All group members should participate.

* Goal of the talk:
    + Tell us a data story related to your research question.
    + Include: Hook, well-defined and well motivated question, how you answered that question, key takeaways.
    + Make sure to include visuals!

* NOT the goal: To give us an exhaustive list of everything you have done since the last presentation.

---


## Second Round of Progress Report Presentations

* Will be recorded.

* Stakeholders will either be in attendance or will watch recording.

* Audience: Class mates and other project stakeholders
    + Make sure to not assume prior knowledge.

* Week 10 Team Leader: 
    + In-charge of organizing the presentation so that your team tells a coherent story.
    + Submit the slide deck or a URL to your slide deck to Gradescope by 10am.
    + Add the slide deck or a URL to your group's GitHub repository.  
        + Make clear where slides are located.
